I'm not a veteran of romance stories, especially not romance anime, but I still feel confident in saying this was a good show.
At first glance, It didn’t *succumb* to the more harmful tropes of the genre, but they were still there.  It flowed naturally, kept good pacing and focus throughout, had interesting conflict that tied directly to the character's development, even if the story does not feel complete.  There's a second season coming, so we can't judge it for that.
The story focuses on Shirayuki, a young herbalist girl with rare bright red hair.  She draws the attention of a sleazy local lord,and in her attempt to escape, she runs into Zen, the prince of a neighboring country.  The parody on the Snow White fairy tale is brief and clever, complete with a poisoned apple.  Zen rescues her, and she eventually finds her way to his castle to study as a court herbalist.  They develop a close friendship, and while it is obvious from the beginning how Zen feels and where the story is going, it doesn’t feel rushed.  The world doesn’t bend over backwards to accommodate their budding relationship.  


Typical romance clichés are sidestepped, but not avoided.  I was interested to find that many of the typical tropes I disliked so much were there: the misunderstanding, the love triangle, the shock of one towards the other’s feelings.  However, they were all handled well.  The love triangle was handled as if both men involved were mature adults who wanted the best for her.  One stepped aside without making it an issue, while the other never noticed (very much like Sydney Carton).  The way Shirayuki reacted to Zen’s kiss was natural.  It didn’t feel written.  The misunderstanding is treated more as Shirayuki trying to sort out her feelings rather than either one being unreasonable (or stupid).  Unlike in other stories, this flows naturally into the resolution, and doesn’t come to a halt and jerk into the opposite direction.  


This story was impressive because it felt real.  It felt like someone were actually recounting a romance between to real individuals.  Their reactions, their motivations, their weaknesses, their decisions: it all seemed reasonable and human.  So often I find that elements of the story or the characters themselves are exaggerated, and I’ve always found that unnecessary.  This story proved what I believed all along: a real romance is exciting and vibrant all on its own.  Seeing two people fall in love is something we love to watch in real life; why not leave it that way when telling a story?  


The romance transitioned so smoothly out of their friendship, but if I had to nitpick, Zen seemed to pop up everywhere.  I thought he seemed a little clingy because of this, even though it wouldn’t have seemed that way to the characters.  What we see as day by day may be weeks for them (still, the author is aware of this, so…).  Also, the situation seems a little too perfect.  The character are never asked to give up anything, but I can only assume that's because this is the beginning of a longer story.  For that reason, I can overlook the lack of a deeper story arc.


It’s a great story.  It begins well and ends in a satisfying way, which is rare enough to appreciate.

Having read shoujo manga and watching shoujo for years, this is just your very cliche anime which the plot is guessable. The main characters are pretty straightforward and a stereotypical shoujo character. I still read the manga though since the recent arcs are pretty interesting, but I don't think I would want to go back to watching the anime, if they were to make a season 3.
The most notable points are the sounds since they match the theme very well which quite accurately reflects the vibe of the anime and I still hum some of the soundtracks at times.

It was overall very cliche and bland. You could predict most of the events that occurred and it was pretty boring. It's strange that the characters were attracted to the main character, Shirayuki, just because of her hair color. Honestly, who cares about you hair color that much? I understand that it was a rare hair color but that was taking it a bit too far. 
In most of the scenes outside there was always that wind blowing and that look on their face whenever the wind blew with perfect timing. Someone might've enjoyed it but quite frankly I found it to be cringy andvery cliche, as well as annoying since it happened often. \n\n
But anyway, that was how I saw/viewed the show.

Akagami no Shirayuki-hime is one of the best Shoujo Anime I've ever watched. It is beautifully drawn and everyone has their own characteristics which makes the Anime lively. The Story is really lovely told and never gets boring even tho you could often tell what would happen next, like that Zen would always come and rescue Shirayuki wherever she was.
What I also love about the Anime is that after some serious conversation there was always something funny which broke the silence~
The only thing that was bothering me were all the flashbacks which I often skip because I could tell them by memory..
Also I don'tthink I'm the only one who thinks that Zen and Shirayuki are really cute together - but actually I'm shipping her with someone else~ xD

Akagami no Shirayuki-hime
Romantic fairy tale, anyone?
This story is about love, hardship, dangerous encounters, good humour, and peril. Did I say dangerous twice? The reason why I find this anime to be so enticing is that this anime teachers lessons, just like a fairy tale should. There always has to be heroes in this world.
I'll start with a quick summary of the main plot.
One day as a young girl begins to pack up her herbalist supplies, a royal attendant bursts into her local shop and demands that she fall in love with the prince of her country. She stands mortified that such a request be askedof herself, and proceeds to escape the country in search of somewhere safe. From there, her wonderful adventure begins within a new country and with a chance encounter with a fellow who will change her life.\n\n
What can we learn here? \n
1) The main character is a herbalist in profession. She probably enjoys discovering new remedies to cure illness and wounds.\n
2) The royal family within her home country rules with a tyranny hand based upon how the attendant burst into the shop.  The main character has good reason for wanting to escape.\n
3) Leaving the country on her own means that she must hone some type of independent skills, and also is the type of person to build strong bonds with others in order to survive.\n
4) Keep in mind that this is a fairy tale and so really dramatic events will ensue.\n\n
Pay attention to the morals taught in this anime. You might just learn something useful.\n\n
Alrighty, I will carry on with the ratings:\n
Story - 9 - This solid slice of life genre follows one main goal. The commoner girl and prince must find love without upsetting the kingdom. As well, few questions were left unanswered here, but the story line does enough of a job to allow the viewer to make an educated guess as to how those questions are answered and how those stories will end.\n
Graphics - 9 - Very very bright and detailed graphics. Sometimes even eye-poppingly bright. This all gives a feeling of richness to the colour.\n
Characters - 9 - The anime does a fine job in explaining the depth of characters and how they relate to one another.  Even the villains are given good reason for their actions, however selfish those actions may be.\n
Music - 9 - Kind of like a beautiful state of trance at times. \n\n
Overall - 9 - The avg divides flawlessly on this one. Perfect 9 in the romance category.\n
Recommended - Unless fairy tales are too joyously offensive for you, I recommend this to you hoping that you are interested in an innocent bucket of love.

STORY:  So what's so special about the story in this anime? I'll tell you. Nothing. Literally nothing. The anime had a good potential but I feel like nothing happened. Episode one and two were way too fast progressing and in the rest of the anime nothing happened. [5]
ART: The art was okay. Small details, not much but still noticeable. [7]
SOUND: Didn't like the OP or the ED. The overall music was decent but nothing special. [5]
CHARACTER: If you like girls who behave childish in front of a boy even if he already told you that he loves you this anime is for you. Samegoes for the guy. He already confessed and still behaves like he didn't. [3]\n\n
So overall: I didn't like the anime and I can't recommend it either. I personally love romance anime but this anime was a disaster and definitely not enjoyable at all. [3]\n\n
Rating: 4,4 ~ 4

This anime is one of those cheesy corny romance stories.  It doesn't revolve around the romance 24/7 though.  The heroine tries to solve her own problems and bumps into prince charming.  Prince charming has his own issues but vows to protect the heroine.  Predictable storyline. 
The story isn't spectacular.  It isn't a gripping one, nor is it waterworks either.  It is just simple and light hearted and predictable.
I liked the art style.  It was cute, especially prince Zen. The characters weren't really that developed or deep.  This is a pure type romance where they just bump handsand turn immensely red.\n\n
Overall the story is just light hearted and cheesy.  It is a nice anime to pass the time.

*This review takes consideration of the second season*
This anime is probably the biggest reason I should lose my Man card.
A disney-like romance story that I cant help but get so giddly happy and fuzzy when I see the main couple on screen.
It isn't so simple for them to get together, they live in a world where class and birth dictate where one is to be placed and respected.
Unfortunately for our couple, they are in different places of hierarchy. A Prince and a peasant so to say.
But our female lead isn't useless, while not physically strong, her knowledge and  earnestness shows how strong she canbe to the world and people around her.


And our male lead isn't perfect. He needs to learn how to be with people, how to properly dictate his actions and make sure his leadership and power isn't misused.


How these two have growth in personality, goals, and their relationship. It's just so damn uplifting. Even when there is strife, they continue to push forward to make sure they can move on.


Our couple aren't the only enjoyable ones here, the others who are supporting or against our couple are also awesome to have on screen. This is especially so in the second season, where returning characters or new, a viewer can get so happy to see what they do.


The second season also gets the story and characters to be better and better.


The biggest salt in the wound for me, was that there IS NO DAMN WEDDING EPISODE. Frig, maybe I just want to see more of the couple embrace each other. No, that's exactly what I want.


It's a great watch for romance, while some may call it cheesy, I think its "LOOK AT THEM, THEY'RE SO GOOD TOGETHER. YES! SHOW THE WORLD YOUR STRENGTH AND WILL TOGETHER!"

Akagami no Shirayuki-hime or Snow White with Red Hair is a nice change from the typical shoujo genre. In the past while watching or reading other shoujo works, a common point is to have the main heroine and her love interest go through some kind of strife in their relationship. This device can easily take up a majority of the plot over the course of many episodes, and really affects the delivery of the story. Thankful this show tries to act smarter than this and overall tries to avoids anything of the sort. If you are hesitant to give this show a watch over suchdrama, then fear not. Moving onwards, the characters are fairly typical, you have the lead and her love interest, and a few side characters in the background to move the plot along. To give the show credit, it tries to give them at least some characterization, so that they aren't fictional nobodies by the end of the story, though as you would expect from a shoujo, a lot of effort goes towards the advancing of the relationship between the two leads. Up next is the sound, and to be honest it's fairly bland, you have your sad background music when there's a sad scene, and the bubbly happy stuff if the scene is comedic or happy. The opening and ending songs aren't much better and overall they're really forgettable. Overall I myself had a pleasant experience with this piece, and I would recommend this to people who enjoy the genre.

Akagami no shirayukihime is one of those anime's which just makes you smile like a huge idiot. It's refreshing and is recommended for those who want an anime which they will just smile whilst watching it.
Story:
The story is about a girl with exceptionally red hair, who leaves her home country because the Prince of her country orders her to be his concubine. Not wanting to loose her freedom she cuts her hair and runs away. She then soon meets Zen  who accompanies her to the path she wants to take to her own story,too her own life... Right off the bat this story hassome elements of a typical shoujo anime where the female lead meets a Prince. However, this story breaks a few conventions of shoujo and makes the female lead actually fend for herself sometimes and not rely on the male lead to save her sweet ass. Other anime do this as well but the one thing I love about this show is that she is very smart and dependable and the characters contrast together well.


Art:


I never really focused on the art style of anime but I tried looking at how the art work was in this anime. I liked the look of the characters they looked aesthetically pleasing to me especially the eyes. The backgrounds were also very crisp and had a good look to them.


Sound:


At first I didn't really like the sound track because I'm not really that into light hearted music. However after some episodes without skipping the opening or ending I got into it. The ending was my favourite out of all the songs.


Characters:


Shirayuki: A smart girl who can defend for herself but she has a hard time asking for help. She can be a bit stubborn but she means well. This is what I mainly like about her, even she has a side that she wants to fix about herself,the stubbornness. 


Zen: Zen is also stubborn as well. He loves his country and the people who support him. He likes acting on things and doesn't like sitting back doing nothing. But of course he sometimes can't do most things like he wants to because of his social status but he finds a way to around it.


Shirayuki and Zen's relationship is something I wish for myself in the future to be honest. They are naturally romantic with each other even when they started off as friends. It just came naturally and you can see the friendship and strong bond they have. This was the key thing that made me fall in love with this show.


Enjoyment: I watched this a few times before I even had a MAL account and I still would. I still remember the the first time I watched it when it was airing and every time after school i would come home from a stressful day at school and watch it. It took my mind of things that were going on in real life and just made me really happy. Even now it still makes me happy.


Overall: 


I would recommend to those who want to watch something that will make them smile and also to those who want something that doesn't fit the conventions of normal shoujo anime's (not like there is anything wrong with them but they can get a bit boring at times) It might not be for people who aren't really into the whole romance thing and more into shounen and the likes but it's a good experience.

Romance anime should show how does the love story progresses. They show it through how the couple actually develops throughout the story, having the realization that they need each other by their side. The problem is, when there is too much emotion in a certain scene, the actions made by the characters sometimes turn into a unreasonable one. The problem with unreasonable actions or the ones that you call "that escalated quickly" scenes in anime, the emotion that the scene tries impose to the character actually turns into comedic one or becomes laughable at that point, making you think that the characters itself are stupidor idiots.


What I like in this anime is that the character developments are well explained. At the start of the anime, Shirayuki is actually confused on what "path" she should take until she meets Zen, which also had his own problems in his princely life. Shirayuki's fiery personality and stubbornness actually makes her character cool. But sometimes, Shirayuki's actions in the anime are sometimes jumpy. When someone actually forces you to be brought to the prince at once, you won't just cut your hair and leave the country. At that point, what I thought is where is Shirayuki's family or friends. I actually got disappointed at the part where she cuts her hair because that made her beauty lesser, and sometimes I lack the past about Shirayuki. Like how she became a herbalist and why is she even alone in her house? Overall, I like Shirayuki and she's the prettiest girl I've ever in anime (but she cut her hair). What I like with the character of Zen is his life throwbacks are too deep and how he developed his way of thinking. It portrays that everyone should not wish of a royal life because you don't know what Zen is going through. These realizations that spouted from the anime is another thing why I liked the anime. Zen also makes "jumpy" actions, which happened on the tower where he kissed Shirayuki after looking in her injury. Some characters could've been developed more, like the royal guards or the court herbalist. But all in all, the story is clear and the you won't feel incomplete after the anime.


For a romance anime lover, this will definitely a good choice.

A wholesome fairytale shoujo to cleanse your mind of all the gore and psychological horror (that I love so dearly).
The show is nothing new or groundbreaking, and the premise is a little flimsy, but the characters are all pretty solid. The only flaw is that most of the characters have no flaws. 
Shirayuki is kind, hardworking, and a talented herbalist. I can see why everyone who meets her likes her--she's just one of those people who can brighten your day. She also has a solid level of sass and cleverness that always takes people by surprise. She's not intimidated by riches or rank, but hasnone of the recklessness that we usually associate with that attitude. 


Even though her romance with Prince Zen is completely obvious from the beginning, I do like their dynamic and the way they build mutual respect before they even approach the romance angle.


I want to shout out to the animators for their masterful use of lighting in this show. Not just the traditional shoujo sparkles, each landscape scene (especially the ones at sunrise) is absolutely beautiful.

Akagami no Shirayuki-hime:
This was apparently recommended to me by a friend and I have a few regrets that I should have watched this sooner. An anime with a modern twist to the Snow White story! (albeit better) The story is quite intriguing, following the lives of Shirayuki and Prince Zen (and all the other supporting characters!) The art is so lovely, along with the sound. (I swear I got the first opening song stuck in my head for a few days.) The character development is quite amazing, especially for both Shirayuki and Zen. It also contains small quirks and hilarious bits. It also has thosescenes where you would just bury your face on a pillow from how precious Shirayuki and Zen is. The problems arising on episodes are really good and tested each character quite well. A light-weight anime that would get your heart enjoying every bit of the ride.\n\n
So, 10/10? :~)

Akagami no Shirayuki-hime in a word is: Charming
It takes a very interesting spin on the classic tale of Snow White. Even though the fairy tale may have been the inspiration for this anime, it is very unique. (So don't compare this to Disney's Snow White in the slightest!)
I was a little worried that the main girl (Shirayuki) was going to turn into a weak, pathetic female lead that is more useless and annoying than anything else (like Haruka in Uta no Prince-sama). Luckily, this was not the case! 
The story felt a little slow in the middle, but it picked up and season 2 iseven better than season 1. The animation is gorgeous. The Prince is gorgeous.\n\n
If you are a lover of Shojo, make sure this anime is a priority on your "must watch" list.

Akagami No Shirayuki-hime is about Shirayuki, a redheaded herbalist who's considered to be the most wonderful girl in the kindoom. Per se, the prince wants to force her to marry him.
Well... I don't really have much to say about this one... It's a pretty basic shoujo to say the least and the first episodes were really boring, the plot is really fucking slow and absolutely anything happens until the end but hey, It wasn't THAT bad, It was actually kind of fun and if you're really into love stories you'll probably really enjoy this one. most of the episodes have individual stories and most ofthem are about Shirayuki gettin' in trouble and Zen having to save her ass but yeah, I can't say I hated it, the story is pretty inspiring too. The next season it's gonna be airing this winter, I hope it'll be more... "active" than this one.

This was probably one of my favorites from 2015, and if your into romance and/or fantasy, or you just want to see good art and music, than i'm sure it'll be your favorite too.
Story 8/10- For how good the show is ,the story is pretty simple and it kind of abandons the snow-white idea that it was going for, which disappointed me at first, but i ended up liking the simple yet endearing story that was given to me.
Art 9/10- Just right of the bat, Akagami is a very beautiful anime with great looking visuals and a great art style..that is all.
Sound 10/10- I can'treally say in full, how much i love the soundtrack in this anime, it had me in both awe and in peace whenever the music kicked in, and i can't wait until the OST comes out so that I can listen to it all day.\n\n
Character 9/10 - All of the main and most of the sound characters are enjoyable, as well as endearing. The show even made me love a character i hated in the first episode, love in his next appearance, and the main couple is so cute they had me smiling like an idiot every time they were on screen together\n\n
Enjoyment 10/10- Like i said earlier, the main couple is so cute that they managed to make me have a huge smile on my face every time they interacted, and that is quite the feat for me. I also love watching the story unfold and watching all the characters interact in different ways, as well as watch Shirayuki herself gain the respect of those around her. \n\n
Overall- 10/10

This is an amazing show and I cant wait to see it continued and hope it will be. I hope that the story grows to be more interesting as it goes on. The best part I like about this story is Shirayuki is very strong and she is one who will stand for others. She reminds me of how strong I am when I am with others. this anime is amazing and I would tell others about it. it is a beautiful love story and can't wait for season 2. The love between her and Zen is amazing I was jumping out of my seatin the last 2 episodes because I had a feeling to what was going on and it work out to it as well, not giving any spoilers but this anime is one that will keep you interested until the end and give you a big relief.

This anime was always monopolize the first/second rank in unofficial Anime Poll. I think that's why I watched it. I'm actually not a fan of romance but I find myself enjoy watching this anime.
Ever since the anime start, it's getting more and more fans especially for the romance lover.
Story (7/10)
Like another romance story, that need to be happly ever after. Although I like it when there's another story or flashback from the side characters or the main character itself.
Art (9/10)
It was very beautiful. I really love the setting and the scenery inside this anime. We can't find much fantasy anime with these beautiful art. Maybethat's why I didn't intend to read the manga even if I wannna know more about the story.\n
Character (8/10)\n
The story is one thing, I really like when the characters treasure each other and not giving up even if their status was way different. And I personally love both of Zen and Shirayuki for their personality.

If you like fairy tales and romance here it is with Snow White With The Red Hair. I enjoyed watching every episode of this series because it relates a lot to classical prince and commoner romance stories such as Cinderella and Snow White, for the main character being a beautiful citizen of a city (Shirayuki) and the prince (Zen) encountering each other. I also enjoyed seeing the progression with the main characters and how they overcome challenges that are presented to them. If you are a fan of romance I highly recommend this anime to you. The series is also very unique because it relatesto fair tales but doesn't follow them completely, which leads to a new story for the series.

Please be aware that "Art" rating stands for anime ambience and "Sound" stand for "Lore".
Enjoyment : 10 / 10
Akagami no Shirayuki-hime is an anime i watched in less than 12 hours, which is really fast for that kind of shoujo anime. I started to watch it because i was bored and it really helped me that day. Thank you Shirayuki.
Story : 6 / 10
There is not much to say about its story. The first episode goes really fast, Shirayuki leaves here city and randomly meets the prince. After some diverse adventures that really shows how brave is Shirayuki, she starts to work to stay withthe prince just by herself and i think that part of the anime was the most interesting.

Once she's set in the castle, some random twists pops out and the anime slowly goes toward its end. The love between Shirayuki and the prince grows at the same time (despite the first prince pressure) and they end up both together. Yay ! Happy end. The story sometimes lack "credibility" (can't find another word) so, alas!, i can't rate it highter than a fair 6.


Ambiance : 7 / 10


As a huge OST fan, i often listen to incredibly intense soundtracks and i must say i'm not frustrated at all by Akagami no Shirayuki-hime's. The OSTs and sound effects are really light but fit the anime action pretty well. However, i didn't even fully listen to the opening even the first time because of how BORING it was.

For the graphic part, the anime, without having an outstanding animation and chara design, is pretty good and is a pleasure to watch.


Lore : 5 / 10


I believe Shirayuki lives in a paper-made world. It has almost no story nor specificities when it's not about herbs. I guess this lack of information participate in the anime simplicity but it's simple really sad we don't know a single thing about the place our heroin lives.


Characters : 9 / 10


I loved almost every character of the anime. The story may be straight forward, it doesn't mean the characters are all stereotypes.

Shirayuki is not the weak and reliant little girl that she could have been. She fights enemies and life with incredible courage and strengh, never gives anything up and always stays straightforward and sincere in any situation. And she is lovely.

Zen one of the kindest character i've ever seen in anime and even with his entourage's pressure, i never renounce to Shirayuki.


Special mention to Obi which totally reminds me Izaya Orihara in his sneaky ways.

A very poor excuse of a romance anime. You probably won't find a more generic and unrealistic couple in any other anime. Basically, the two main characters fall in love with each other for no particular reason whatsoever. After they become a couple, they have no fights or conflicts of any sort, and they're pretty much a perfect lovey-dovey couple. For an anime centered around romance, it probably helps to have a romance that actually contains meaningful and realistic development. You'll find nothing like that here, this is paint-by-numbers Disney-esque romance. That being said, the artwork and music in this anime is absolutely tremendous, andthe female MC is a pretty cool character.


PROS:

+ Tremendous artwork

+ Nice musical score

+ Female MC is a cool character


CONS:

- Absolutely horrendous romance

- It's just..... boring

- Central plot seems non-existent


FINAL SCORE: 6/10

It seems that every year, I grow to appreciate the art of animation every year, by growing fonder of different studios, actors, techniques, narrative styles, and directors and the conclusion I have come to is that without Japanese animation, I would not harbor the appreciation for storytelling that I possess now. It takes a special kind of show to remind me of that to the point that I am left breathless by what has transpired. Akagami no Shirayuki-hime, or Snow White with the Red Hair, is that show.
In the kingdom of Tanbarun lives a beautiful young woman with beautiful hair, bright and red as anapple, a trait said to be unusual in this world. Her name is Shirayuki, and she is a herbalist. But one day, the mischievous Prince Raj hears of her and demands that she become his concubine. Not wanting any part of his wicked plans, she spends all night concocting medicine for every one of her clients in town, packs up her things, and cuts her long hair short, leaving the remainder on the window sill for the devious prince who craved it so. As she leaves she meets Zen, the prince of Clarines, and together, they chart a path to Zen's homeland so that Shirayuki may follow her dreams, not stopping for anyone or anything. And so begins a young woman's journey of discovery, adventure, and love.


Akagami is just as much a story of empowerment as it is a story of love. Shirayuki is the single greatest female character in anime and I am aware of the weight of such a claim. She constantly faces danger head on using her wits rather than resorting to combat to solve her disputes and her willingness to stand up to those who think less of her for her social class is an inspiring sight that deserves to be seen. She is the type of character I will tell stories about to my future children, especially if I have a daughter. When she meets Zen, the male lead and love interest of the show, they certainly make for great friends and perhaps she is attracted to him, but her motivations for going to his country with him are not to pursue him but to achieve her own dreams. She wants to be a court herbalist in his kingdom because herbology is a passion of hers. It is an extension of her desire to help people. Yet despite this, the show doesn't ever judge her for also having real feelings for Zen and neither should it. She proves time and time again through the show that she is entirely in control of her destiny, and when that control is taken away, she fights using her knowledge rather than brawn as it would go against her character to do otherwise.


Zen is likewise a phenomenal character. His romance with Shirayuki is handled beautifully and the two talk with one another in a way that breaks down the barriers of their social classes, establishing each other as equals. When Shirayuki's life is in danger, Zen scolds her for acting rashly in order to prove that someone is after her, but Shirayuki confidently affirms that she is aware of the dangers and doesn't need to be scolded. And Zen compromises with her. The two are a paragon of trust and friendship, which makes the romantic development so much sweeter in the long run. His protective nature is inspiring but he doesn't overdo it and fully trusts Shirayuki.


That being said, the rest of the cast is delightful as well, from Zen's two attendants, Mitsuhide and Kiki, to the mischievous Obi, to the Chief herbalist, to Shirayuki's young partner Ryuu, the cast is beaming with personality and charm. Even Raj, despite being an antagonist at first, grows to be likable, if a bit of a goof. Aiding in the character department is the acting. Funimation's dub for Akagami is the best dub I have heard from them in a while, with the honorable mentions being Brina Palencia as Shirayuki, Josh Grelle as Zen, and Rachel Robinson as Garack Gazelt. If you are going to watch this show, watch it dubbed. It is worth it, trust me.


If I had to describe this show in one phrase, it would be "Ghibli-esque." The visuals, vocal performances, and music all come together to make a show that captures the wonder and beauty that captivated me about movies such as Spirited Away, Castle in the Sky, or the Cat Returns. The animation is done by Studio Bones, who I praised in my review of Kekkai Sensen as being the best animation studio in the world. This show is no different in terms of visual quality. It is beautiful and I can't imagine any other studio creating the same environments nearly as well.


The show is directed by Masahiro Ando, who's resume speaks for itself. He directed Sword of the Stranger, a truly phenomenal hidden gem of the late 2000's and he also was the choreographer for the Cowboy Bebop movie and a key animator on some of the most critically acclaimed anime of all time. The guy might not get as much recognition as other big directors in the industry, but he is more than worthy of the respect.


The music is composed by Michiru Oshima, who has previously worked on the original Fullmetal Alchemist, Little Witch Academia, and Rokka no Yuusha, among many others. Her music works best for bright and colorful fantasy shows such as this. The feeling of joy that one receives by listening to her tracks almost makes her music easily identifiable. Without even knowing her name or knowing her involvement with other shows, I could tell she was that I was listening to her music just by listening to it when I watched Rokka no Yuusha a few months back.


When I rewatched the first season of Akagami with my sister in preparation for this review, she didn't quite understand after the first couple of episodes why I held the show in such high regard. She was captivated and wanted to continue because she enjoyed it, but she hadn't quite yet understood why I loved it so much. Seeing the characters grow stronger and closer together made it clear, and rewatching it strengthened my resolve in concluding that Akagami no Shirayuki-hime is a happy, beautiful, romantic masterpiece.


This show shows me the reason I watch Anime: To let my mind wander and to immerse myself in the machinations of creators who love to let their imaginations run wild just like me and who want to leave an impression on my mind, and my heart. I wish there was more I could do to thank them.


WHERE TO WATCH IT:


Akagami no Shirayuki-hime is available for legal streaming through Funimation Now and available on Blu-ray and DVD. Season 2 will be released on DVD on April 25th, 2017. Expect a review or at least a recommendation for that season as well after I have rewatched it.

~Story~ 8 
This story is about young Shirayuki. She runs from her kingdom because due to her rare hair color, Shirayuki gets a proposal to be a concubine of the foolish but famous prince Raji. While traveling, she meets a boy named Zen, who accidentally gets injured, and she boldly cures his wounds. They become friends, and she finds out than Zen is actually a prince and he saves her from being taken by Raji. They later go to his palace, where she applies for the job as the court herbalist to be able to go freely to the castle where Zen is. 
~Art~ 8\n
The art is fluent and the characters look stunning, mind you it's not just the characters that look absolutely amazing it's also the backgrounds that make me watch with awe. It is truly a skill to be able to make such art. \n
~Sound~ 8 \n
The opening song was beautiful and catchy, same with the ending although it was more sweet then beautiful. I enjoyed the voice actors for the English dub, but seeing how I did not watch the sub I cannot give my personal opinion on the voice acting on that side, but I'm sure it too was lovely. \n
~Character~ 9 \n
I loved the characters in this anime. They were funny and sweet and truly amusing to watch. Shirayuki defies the traits of a typical shoujo lead. She is socially capable, strong-willed, is not afraid to speak her mind and has actually has a brain which knows her limits. Shirayuki holds her own and yearns to seek position for her to see Zen as her equal.  she is very rational and thinks before she acts.  Zen, on the other hand, might err at times to your typical male shoujo character but a closer examination reveals that he is not. While he is kind, his past (a very painful one, mind you) reveals what made him like he is as portrayed. He might be likable and composed but his aversion to his much lord brother is palpable. He also narrowly avoided the sparkly main lead syndrome by toning down some of his traits and by not giving him a chick magnet role.  All other recurring characters were also given ample time to get some development. Mitsuhide and Izana benefited from Zen's flashback of his past so much that it can be also viewed that certain story was theirs and not Zen's. They were also elevated from plot device to actual characters which interact with the leads (and contribute to their future paths) without the feeling of emotional manipulation. Obi, on the other hand, is a very interesting oddball which complemented Zen's calm nature. He is quite perceptive and throws statements which drive the series to a positive direction. \n
 ~enjoyment~ 10 \n
I really enjoyed this anime. Although it may seem silly but I actually really admire Shirayuki, she is strong willed, intelligent, and she has my dream job. I loved watching how everyone interacted and how all their relationships progressed.  \n
~overall~ 9 \n
I highly recommend this anime to everyone. No it does not have magic powers and different dimensions, but it has a sweet love story. Plus it is set in a more old time fashion, with princes and court herbalists.

The sound part fulfills Is well done during the episodes, but it is not memorable. The characters are also a strong point in this anime. In the end, it's a nice romantic adventure.

I loved this anime, while basic with story line and character experiences I've always loved a good "fairy tale". The story follows a adventures (and misadventures) of a ordinary girl that keeps seeming to be targeted for her unusual coloring. What I truly loved about this anime was the art style, and how I was able to relate to the main character. For me having an "ordinary" girl take great leaps and bounds in her own life, leaving everything she knew on a whim, is something I can relate to. Overall I think this short anime is a great watch for anyone who wants totake a step back from the "overly special main character" anime and just enjoy a good story.
